controllers.smc.algorithms.super_twisting.twisting_algorithmÂ¶

Source: src\controllers\smc\algorithms\super_twisting\twisting_algorithm.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Super-Twisting Algorithm Implementation.

Implements the core Super-Twisting sliding mode algorithm for finite-time convergence. The algorithm provides second-order sliding mode control with chattering reduction.

Mathematical Background:

  • Control law: u = uâ‚ + uâ‚‚

  • uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)

  • uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt

  • Stability: Kâ‚ > Kâ‚‚ > 0 for finite-time convergence

Advanced Mathematical TheoryÂ¶

Super-Twisting Control LawÂ¶

Two-component structure:

\[u = u_1 + u_2 = -K_1 |s|^{\alpha} \text{sign}(s) - K_2 \int \text{sign}(s) dt\]

Where:

  • \(K_1, K_2 > 0\): Gains

  • \(\alpha \in (0, 1)\): Exponent (typically 0.5)

  • \(u_1\): Continuous feedback (no chattering)

  • \(u_2\): Integral term (finite-time convergence)

Finite-Time ConvergenceÂ¶

Convergence time bound:

\[t_{conv} \leq \frac{2 |s(0)|^{1-\alpha/2}}{\eta (1 - \alpha/2)}\]

Sliding variable and its derivative both reach zero:

\[s = \dot{s} = 0 \quad \text{in finite time}\]

Gain Selection CriteriaÂ¶

Sufficient conditions for finite-time stability:

\[\begin{split}\begin{align} K_1 &> \frac{L_1}{\lambda_{min}^{1/2}} \\ K_2 &> \frac{K_1 L_1}{\lambda_{min}} + \frac{L_0}{\lambda_{min}} \end{align}\end{split}\]

Where:

  • \(L_0, L_1\): Bounds on disturbance and its derivative

  • \(\lambda_{min}\): Minimum eigenvalue of system matrix

Lyapunov AnalysisÂ¶

Lyapunov function candidate:

\[V = \zeta^T \mathbf{P} \zeta, \quad \zeta = [|s|^{\alpha} \text{sign}(s), \, \dot{s}]^T\]

Where \(\mathbf{P} = \mathbf{P}^T > 0\) is found via LMI.

Homogeneity property enables finite-time analysis.

Second-Order Sliding ModeÂ¶

Sliding manifold:

\[\mathcal{S} = \{(s, \dot{s}) : s = \dot{s} = 0\}\]

Ensures both position and velocity errors converge.

Continuous ControlÂ¶

No sign function in control:

  • \(u_1\) uses \(|s|^{0.5} \text{sign}(s)\) (continuous)

  • \(u_2\) is integral (smooth)

  • Result: Continuous control signal (minimal chattering)

Architecture DiagramÂ¶

graph TD A[Sliding Surface s] --> B[Continuous: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign_s_] A --> C[Integral: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign_s_dt] B --> D[Combiner: u = uâ‚ + uâ‚‚] C --> D C --> E[Anti-Windup] E -->|Saturation Active| F[Halt Integration] E -->|No Saturation| G[Continue Integration] D --> H[Control Output u] style B fill:#9cf style C fill:#ff9 style H fill:#9f9

Usage ExamplesÂ¶

Example 1: Basic InitializationÂ¶

from src.controllers.smc.algorithms.super_twisting import *

# Initialize with configuration
config = {'parameter': 'value'}
instance = Component(config)

Example 2: Performance TuningÂ¶

# Adjust parameters for better performance
optimized_params = tune_parameters(instance, target_performance)

Example 3: Integration with ControllerÂ¶

# Use in complete control loop
controller = create_controller(ctrl_type, config)
result = simulate(controller, duration=5.0)

Example 4: Edge Case HandlingÂ¶

try:
    output = instance.compute(state)
except ValueError as e:
    handle_edge_case(e)

Example 5: Performance AnalysisÂ¶

# Analyze metrics
metrics = compute_metrics(result)
print(f"ITAE: {metrics.itae:.3f}")

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#======== src/controllers/smc/algorithms/super_twisting/twisting_algorithm.py =========\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""
  6Super-Twisting Algorithm Implementation.
  7
  8Implements the core Super-Twisting sliding mode algorithm for finite-time convergence.
  9The algorithm provides second-order sliding mode control with chattering reduction.
 10
 11Mathematical Background:
 12- Control law: u = uâ‚ + uâ‚‚
 13- uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)
 14- uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt
 15- Stability: Kâ‚ > Kâ‚‚ > 0 for finite-time convergence
 16"""
 17
 18from typing import Optional, Dict, Any
 19import numpy as np
 20import math
 21
 22
 23class SuperTwistingAlgorithm:
 24    """
 25    Core Super-Twisting sliding mode algorithm.
 26
 27    Implements second-order sliding mode control with finite-time convergence:
 28    - Continuous control component: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)
 29    - Integral component: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt
 30    """
 31
 32    def __init__(self,
 33                 K1: float,
 34                 K2: float,
 35                 alpha: float = 0.5,
 36                 anti_windup_limit: Optional[float] = None,
 37                 regularization: float = 1e-10):
 38        """
 39        Initialize Super-Twisting algorithm.
 40
 41        Args:
 42            K1: First twisting gain (K1 > K2 > 0)
 43            K2: Second twisting gain
 44            alpha: Power exponent âˆˆ (0, 1] (standard = 0.5)
 45            anti_windup_limit: Limit for integral component
 46            regularization: Small value to prevent division by zero
 47        """
 48        if K2 >= K1 or K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
 49            raise ValueError("Super-Twisting requires K1 > K2 > 0")
 50        if not (0 < alpha <= 1):
 51            raise ValueError("Power exponent must be in (0, 1]")
 52        if regularization <= 0:
 53            raise ValueError("Regularization must be positive")
 54
 55        self.K1 = K1
 56        self.K2 = K2
 57        self.alpha = alpha
 58        self.anti_windup_limit = anti_windup_limit
 59        self.regularization = regularization
 60
 61        # Internal state
 62        self._integral_state = 0.0
 63        self._previous_surface = 0.0
 64
 65    def compute_control(self, surface_value: float, dt: float,
 66                       switching_function: str = "tanh",
 67                       boundary_layer: float = 0.01) -> Dict[str, float]:
 68        """
 69        Compute Super-Twisting control law.
 70
 71        Args:
 72            surface_value: Current sliding surface value s
 73            dt: Time step for integration
 74            switching_function: Type of switching function ("tanh", "linear", "sign")
 75            boundary_layer: Boundary layer width for smooth switching
 76
 77        Returns:
 78            Dictionary with control components and diagnostics
 79        """
 80        # Compute switching function
 81        switch_output = self._compute_switching_function(
 82            surface_value, switching_function, boundary_layer
 83        )
 84
 85        # First component: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)
 86        if abs(surface_value) > self.regularization:
 87            u1 = -self.K1 * (abs(surface_value) ** self.alpha) * switch_output
 88        else:
 89            # Regularized version near s = 0
 90            u1 = -self.K1 * (self.regularization ** self.alpha) * switch_output
 91
 92        # Second component: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt
 93        # Update integral state
 94        integral_increment = switch_output * dt
 95        self._integral_state += integral_increment
 96
 97        # Apply anti-windup if specified
 98        if self.anti_windup_limit is not None:
 99            self._integral_state = np.clip(
100                self._integral_state, -self.anti_windup_limit, self.anti_windup_limit
101            )
102
103        u2 = -self.K2 * self._integral_state
104
105        # Total control
106        u_total = u1 + u2
107
108        # Store previous surface for derivative estimation
109        self._previous_surface = surface_value
110
111        return {
112            'u_total': float(u_total),
113            'u1_continuous': float(u1),
114            'u2_integral': float(u2),
115            'integral_state': float(self._integral_state),
116            'switch_output': float(switch_output),
117            'surface_power': float(abs(surface_value) ** self.alpha),
118            'regularization_active': abs(surface_value) <= self.regularization
119        }
120
121    def _compute_switching_function(self, s: float, method: str, epsilon: float) -> float:
122        """
123        Compute switching function sign(s) with smooth approximation.
124
125        Args:
126            s: Surface value
127            method: Switching method ("tanh", "linear", "sign")
128            epsilon: Boundary layer width
129
130        Returns:
131            Switching function output
132        """
133        if method == "sign":
134            return np.sign(s)
135        elif method == "tanh":
136            if epsilon <= 0:
137                return np.sign(s)
138            return np.tanh(s / epsilon)
139        elif method == "linear":
140            if epsilon <= 0:
141                return np.sign(s)
142            return np.clip(s / epsilon, -1, 1)
143        else:
144            raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching method: {method}")
145
146    def reset_state(self) -> None:
147        """Reset algorithm internal state."""
148        self._integral_state = 0.0
149        self._previous_surface = 0.0
150
151    def set_gains(self, K1: float, K2: float) -> None:
152        """
153        Update twisting gains.
154
155        Args:
156            K1, K2: New twisting gains (must satisfy K1 > K2 > 0)
157        """
158        if K2 >= K1 or K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
159            raise ValueError("Super-Twisting requires K1 > K2 > 0")
160        self.K1 = K1
161        self.K2 = K2
162
163    def get_gains(self) -> tuple[float, float]:
164        """Get current twisting gains (K1, K2)."""
165        return (self.K1, self.K2)
166
167    def check_stability_condition(self) -> bool:
168        """Check if current gains satisfy stability condition."""
169        return self.K1 > self.K2 > 0
170
171    def estimate_convergence_time(self, initial_surface: float = 1.0) -> float:
172        """
173        Estimate finite-time convergence time.
174
175        For standard Super-Twisting (Î± = 0.5):
176        T_conv â‰ˆ 2|sâ‚€|^(1-Î±) / Kâ‚‚^Î±
177
178        Args:
179            initial_surface: Initial surface value |sâ‚€|
180
181        Returns:
182            Estimated convergence time
183        """
184        if not self.check_stability_condition():
185            return float('inf')
186
187        if self.alpha == 0.5:
188            # Standard formula for Î± = 0.5
189            return 2.0 * math.sqrt(abs(initial_surface)) / math.sqrt(self.K2)
190        else:
191            # General formula
192            if self.K2 <= 0 or initial_surface <= 0:
193                return float('inf')
194            return ((1 - self.alpha) * (abs(initial_surface) ** (1 - self.alpha))) / (self.K2 ** self.alpha)
195
196    def analyze_performance(self, surface_history: list) -> Dict[str, Any]:
197        """
198        Analyze Super-Twisting performance from surface history.
199
200        Args:
201            surface_history: List of historical surface values
202
203        Returns:
204            Performance analysis dictionary
205        """
206        if len(surface_history) < 2:
207            return {'error': 'Insufficient history for analysis'}
208
209        surface_array = np.array(surface_history)
210
211        # Convergence analysis
212        final_values = surface_array[-min(50, len(surface_array)):]
213        convergence_rate = -np.polyfit(range(len(surface_array)), np.log(np.abs(surface_array) + 1e-10), 1)[0]
214
215        # Finite-time convergence detection
216        convergence_threshold = 0.01
217        convergence_idx = None
218        for i, val in enumerate(surface_array):
219            if abs(val) < convergence_threshold:
220                convergence_idx = i
221                break
222
223        return {
224            'stability_metrics': {
225                'gains_satisfy_condition': self.check_stability_condition(),
226                'gain_ratio': self.K1 / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf'),
227                'stability_margin': (self.K1 - self.K2) / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf')
228            },
229            'convergence_metrics': {
230                'convergence_rate': float(convergence_rate),
231                'final_surface_rms': float(np.sqrt(np.mean(final_values**2))),
232                'convergence_detected': convergence_idx is not None,
233                'convergence_time_steps': convergence_idx if convergence_idx is not None else len(surface_array),
234                'theoretical_convergence_time': self.estimate_convergence_time(abs(surface_array[0]))
235            },
236            'control_characteristics': {
237                'integral_state': self._integral_state,
238                'anti_windup_active': self.anti_windup_limit is not None and abs(self._integral_state) >= 0.9 * self.anti_windup_limit,
239                'power_exponent': self.alpha,
240                'regularization_threshold': self.regularization
241            }
242        }
243
244    def get_lyapunov_function(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float) -> float:
245        """
246        Compute Lyapunov function for stability analysis.
247
248        For Super-Twisting: V = Kâ‚‚|s| + 0.5(uâ‚‚ + Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s))Â²
249
250        Args:
251            surface_value: Current surface value s
252            surface_derivative: Surface derivative á¹¡
253
254        Returns:
255            Lyapunov function value
256        """
257        s = surface_value
258        s_abs = abs(s)
259
260        # First term: Kâ‚‚|s|
261        V1 = self.K2 * s_abs
262
263        # Second term: 0.5(uâ‚‚ + Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s))Â²
264        u2 = -self.K2 * self._integral_state
265        u1_equiv = -self.K1 * (s_abs ** self.alpha) * np.sign(s) if s_abs > self.regularization else 0
266
267        V2 = 0.5 * (u2 + u1_equiv) ** 2
268
269        return V1 + V2
270
271    def get_state_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
272        """Get current algorithm state for logging/debugging."""
273        return {
274            'gains': {'K1': self.K1, 'K2': self.K2},
275            'parameters': {
276                'alpha': self.alpha,
277                'anti_windup_limit': self.anti_windup_limit,
278                'regularization': self.regularization
279            },
280            'internal_state': {
281                'integral_state': self._integral_state,
282                'previous_surface': self._previous_surface
283            },
284            'stability': {
285                'gains_valid': self.check_stability_condition(),
286                'gain_ratio': self.K1 / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf')
287            }
288        }

ClassesÂ¶

SuperTwistingAlgorithmÂ¶

Core Super-Twisting sliding mode algorithm.

Implements second-order sliding mode control with finite-time convergence:

  • Continuous control component: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)

  • Integral component: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt

Source CodeÂ¶

  1class SuperTwistingAlgorithm:
  2    """
  3    Core Super-Twisting sliding mode algorithm.
  4
  5    Implements second-order sliding mode control with finite-time convergence:
  6    - Continuous control component: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)
  7    - Integral component: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt
  8    """
  9
 10    def __init__(self,
 11                 K1: float,
 12                 K2: float,
 13                 alpha: float = 0.5,
 14                 anti_windup_limit: Optional[float] = None,
 15                 regularization: float = 1e-10):
 16        """
 17        Initialize Super-Twisting algorithm.
 18
 19        Args:
 20            K1: First twisting gain (K1 > K2 > 0)
 21            K2: Second twisting gain
 22            alpha: Power exponent âˆˆ (0, 1] (standard = 0.5)
 23            anti_windup_limit: Limit for integral component
 24            regularization: Small value to prevent division by zero
 25        """
 26        if K2 >= K1 or K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
 27            raise ValueError("Super-Twisting requires K1 > K2 > 0")
 28        if not (0 < alpha <= 1):
 29            raise ValueError("Power exponent must be in (0, 1]")
 30        if regularization <= 0:
 31            raise ValueError("Regularization must be positive")
 32
 33        self.K1 = K1
 34        self.K2 = K2
 35        self.alpha = alpha
 36        self.anti_windup_limit = anti_windup_limit
 37        self.regularization = regularization
 38
 39        # Internal state
 40        self._integral_state = 0.0
 41        self._previous_surface = 0.0
 42
 43    def compute_control(self, surface_value: float, dt: float,
 44                       switching_function: str = "tanh",
 45                       boundary_layer: float = 0.01) -> Dict[str, float]:
 46        """
 47        Compute Super-Twisting control law.
 48
 49        Args:
 50            surface_value: Current sliding surface value s
 51            dt: Time step for integration
 52            switching_function: Type of switching function ("tanh", "linear", "sign")
 53            boundary_layer: Boundary layer width for smooth switching
 54
 55        Returns:
 56            Dictionary with control components and diagnostics
 57        """
 58        # Compute switching function
 59        switch_output = self._compute_switching_function(
 60            surface_value, switching_function, boundary_layer
 61        )
 62
 63        # First component: uâ‚ = -Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s)
 64        if abs(surface_value) > self.regularization:
 65            u1 = -self.K1 * (abs(surface_value) ** self.alpha) * switch_output
 66        else:
 67            # Regularized version near s = 0
 68            u1 = -self.K1 * (self.regularization ** self.alpha) * switch_output
 69
 70        # Second component: uâ‚‚ = -Kâ‚‚ âˆ«sign(s)dt
 71        # Update integral state
 72        integral_increment = switch_output * dt
 73        self._integral_state += integral_increment
 74
 75        # Apply anti-windup if specified
 76        if self.anti_windup_limit is not None:
 77            self._integral_state = np.clip(
 78                self._integral_state, -self.anti_windup_limit, self.anti_windup_limit
 79            )
 80
 81        u2 = -self.K2 * self._integral_state
 82
 83        # Total control
 84        u_total = u1 + u2
 85
 86        # Store previous surface for derivative estimation
 87        self._previous_surface = surface_value
 88
 89        return {
 90            'u_total': float(u_total),
 91            'u1_continuous': float(u1),
 92            'u2_integral': float(u2),
 93            'integral_state': float(self._integral_state),
 94            'switch_output': float(switch_output),
 95            'surface_power': float(abs(surface_value) ** self.alpha),
 96            'regularization_active': abs(surface_value) <= self.regularization
 97        }
 98
 99    def _compute_switching_function(self, s: float, method: str, epsilon: float) -> float:
100        """
101        Compute switching function sign(s) with smooth approximation.
102
103        Args:
104            s: Surface value
105            method: Switching method ("tanh", "linear", "sign")
106            epsilon: Boundary layer width
107
108        Returns:
109            Switching function output
110        """
111        if method == "sign":
112            return np.sign(s)
113        elif method == "tanh":
114            if epsilon <= 0:
115                return np.sign(s)
116            return np.tanh(s / epsilon)
117        elif method == "linear":
118            if epsilon <= 0:
119                return np.sign(s)
120            return np.clip(s / epsilon, -1, 1)
121        else:
122            raise ValueError(f"Unknown switching method: {method}")
123
124    def reset_state(self) -> None:
125        """Reset algorithm internal state."""
126        self._integral_state = 0.0
127        self._previous_surface = 0.0
128
129    def set_gains(self, K1: float, K2: float) -> None:
130        """
131        Update twisting gains.
132
133        Args:
134            K1, K2: New twisting gains (must satisfy K1 > K2 > 0)
135        """
136        if K2 >= K1 or K1 <= 0 or K2 <= 0:
137            raise ValueError("Super-Twisting requires K1 > K2 > 0")
138        self.K1 = K1
139        self.K2 = K2
140
141    def get_gains(self) -> tuple[float, float]:
142        """Get current twisting gains (K1, K2)."""
143        return (self.K1, self.K2)
144
145    def check_stability_condition(self) -> bool:
146        """Check if current gains satisfy stability condition."""
147        return self.K1 > self.K2 > 0
148
149    def estimate_convergence_time(self, initial_surface: float = 1.0) -> float:
150        """
151        Estimate finite-time convergence time.
152
153        For standard Super-Twisting (Î± = 0.5):
154        T_conv â‰ˆ 2|sâ‚€|^(1-Î±) / Kâ‚‚^Î±
155
156        Args:
157            initial_surface: Initial surface value |sâ‚€|
158
159        Returns:
160            Estimated convergence time
161        """
162        if not self.check_stability_condition():
163            return float('inf')
164
165        if self.alpha == 0.5:
166            # Standard formula for Î± = 0.5
167            return 2.0 * math.sqrt(abs(initial_surface)) / math.sqrt(self.K2)
168        else:
169            # General formula
170            if self.K2 <= 0 or initial_surface <= 0:
171                return float('inf')
172            return ((1 - self.alpha) * (abs(initial_surface) ** (1 - self.alpha))) / (self.K2 ** self.alpha)
173
174    def analyze_performance(self, surface_history: list) -> Dict[str, Any]:
175        """
176        Analyze Super-Twisting performance from surface history.
177
178        Args:
179            surface_history: List of historical surface values
180
181        Returns:
182            Performance analysis dictionary
183        """
184        if len(surface_history) < 2:
185            return {'error': 'Insufficient history for analysis'}
186
187        surface_array = np.array(surface_history)
188
189        # Convergence analysis
190        final_values = surface_array[-min(50, len(surface_array)):]
191        convergence_rate = -np.polyfit(range(len(surface_array)), np.log(np.abs(surface_array) + 1e-10), 1)[0]
192
193        # Finite-time convergence detection
194        convergence_threshold = 0.01
195        convergence_idx = None
196        for i, val in enumerate(surface_array):
197            if abs(val) < convergence_threshold:
198                convergence_idx = i
199                break
200
201        return {
202            'stability_metrics': {
203                'gains_satisfy_condition': self.check_stability_condition(),
204                'gain_ratio': self.K1 / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf'),
205                'stability_margin': (self.K1 - self.K2) / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf')
206            },
207            'convergence_metrics': {
208                'convergence_rate': float(convergence_rate),
209                'final_surface_rms': float(np.sqrt(np.mean(final_values**2))),
210                'convergence_detected': convergence_idx is not None,
211                'convergence_time_steps': convergence_idx if convergence_idx is not None else len(surface_array),
212                'theoretical_convergence_time': self.estimate_convergence_time(abs(surface_array[0]))
213            },
214            'control_characteristics': {
215                'integral_state': self._integral_state,
216                'anti_windup_active': self.anti_windup_limit is not None and abs(self._integral_state) >= 0.9 * self.anti_windup_limit,
217                'power_exponent': self.alpha,
218                'regularization_threshold': self.regularization
219            }
220        }
221
222    def get_lyapunov_function(self, surface_value: float, surface_derivative: float) -> float:
223        """
224        Compute Lyapunov function for stability analysis.
225
226        For Super-Twisting: V = Kâ‚‚|s| + 0.5(uâ‚‚ + Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s))Â²
227
228        Args:
229            surface_value: Current surface value s
230            surface_derivative: Surface derivative á¹¡
231
232        Returns:
233            Lyapunov function value
234        """
235        s = surface_value
236        s_abs = abs(s)
237
238        # First term: Kâ‚‚|s|
239        V1 = self.K2 * s_abs
240
241        # Second term: 0.5(uâ‚‚ + Kâ‚|s|^Î± sign(s))Â²
242        u2 = -self.K2 * self._integral_state
243        u1_equiv = -self.K1 * (s_abs ** self.alpha) * np.sign(s) if s_abs > self.regularization else 0
244
245        V2 = 0.5 * (u2 + u1_equiv) ** 2
246
247        return V1 + V2
248
249    def get_state_dict(self) -> Dict[str, Any]:
250        """Get current algorithm state for logging/debugging."""
251        return {
252            'gains': {'K1': self.K1, 'K2': self.K2},
253            'parameters': {
254                'alpha': self.alpha,
255                'anti_windup_limit': self.anti_windup_limit,
256                'regularization': self.regularization
257            },
258            'internal_state': {
259                'integral_state': self._integral_state,
260                'previous_surface': self._previous_surface
261            },
262            'stability': {
263                'gains_valid': self.check_stability_condition(),
264                'gain_ratio': self.K1 / self.K2 if self.K2 > 0 else float('inf')
265            }
266        }
